Description.Title: Our strengths
Description.Text: Enjoy a breath-taking journey throughout the beautiful landscapes of Croatia and Montenegro, in which you will discover beautiful cities as well as places where nature is queen. Dive into the striking beauty of the Dalmatian coast, stroll through Dubrovnik "the pearl of the Adriatic", Trogir, Hvar, Korcula or Kotor, as well as the national parks of Mljet and Krka.

Description.Title: Highlights
Description.Text:
CRUISE HIGHLIGHTS

  • Fantastic variety of architecture(1)
  • Stunning landscapes and the splendid Bay of Kotor(1)
  • Each island is more beautiful than the last(1)
  • Untamed spectacle of natural waterfalls(1)
  • Beautiful walled cities along the Dalmatian Coast(1)

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK (Croatia)
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board our ship at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we'll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. Presentation of the hiking program followed by dinner on board. The evening is free to do as you please.

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK (Croatia)
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board our ship at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we'll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. Presentation of the hiking program followed by dinner on board. The evening is free to do as you please.

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK - MLJET
Description.Text:
We’ll set out this morning for a guided visit of Dubrovnik, nicknamed "the Pearl of the Adriatic". With its exceptional medieval architecture and its streets paved with marble, the former city of Ragusa is now a must-see place of the Adriatic coast. During our visit we’ll discover the Roman-style Franciscan Church and Monastery built in the 13th century and the Rector's Palace which was the former seat of the government and is now a museum. Our visit will take us to the Assumption cathedral, the St Blaise's Church and the magnificent Sponza Palace built in a mixed Gothic and Renaissance style.

This afternoon:

Non-walker’s Program: Enjoy some time at leisure to discover Dubrovnik. We suggest a stroll around the ramparts(1) which were built to protect the city. Once on top, enjoy a wonderful view over the old town.

Walkers’ Program: Hike to the ruins of the Imperial Fort, with breathtaking views overlooking Dubrovnik's bay. We’ll leave by coach towards the eastside of the city. We’ll climb the Sr¿ Hill passing along the Bosanka village before reaching the ruins.  (Length 2½ to 3 hours, distance of 5 km (3 miles), with a climb of about 400m (1,315 feet.)

Enjoy an evening of dancing as our ship cruises through the night.

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK - MLJET
Description.Text:
We’ll set out this morning for a guided visit of Dubrovnik, nicknamed "the Pearl of the Adriatic".

This afternoon:
Non-walker’s Program: Enjoy some time at leisure to discover Dubrovnik. We suggest a stroll around the ramparts(1) which were built to protect the city. Once on top, enjoy a wonderful view over the old town.
Walkers’ Program: Hike to the ruins of the Imperial Fort, with breathtaking views overlooking Dubrovnik's bay. (Length 2½ to 3 hours, distance of 5 km (3 miles), with a climb of about 400m (1,315 feet.)

Enjoy an evening of dancing as our ship cruises through the night.

Description.Title: MLJET - KORCULA
Description.Text:
We’ll leave for an excursion to Mljet. The greenest Croatian island with its breathtaking natural beauty, clear blue sea and the vast lakes of Malo Jezero and Veliko Jezero, is one of the most beautiful islands of the Adriatic. A Benedictine monastery is located on a tiny island in the middle of Veliko Jezero.

Walkers’ Program: Walk in the Mljet National Park. After our excursion to the Benedictine monastery, we'll have a short hike towards Pomena (Total length 2½ hours, distance of 4 km (2.5 miles), with a climb of about 100m (328 feet).).

We'll return on board at the end of the morning and start cruising to Korcula, one of the large islands of the Adriatic with a hilly landscape.

Non-walker’s Program: Tour of the city and its museum. During our tour we’ll discover, among others, the Cathedral of St Mark built between the 15th and 16th centuries. The museum is located in Gabrielis palace and has various collections covering Korcula’s history and culture from Ancient history to nowadays.

Walkers’ Program: Hiking in Hober Park and St Anton. The park is a protected area where you can admire the bay of Luka Korculanska. An interesting place in Hober Park is Naplov, a large drainage area, which was used to collect rain water before Korcula’s waterworks where installed. A path will take us to St Anton Church located on top of the hill. (Length 4 hours, distance of 10 km (6 miles), with a climb of about 300m (984 feet).)

Enjoy a traditional sword dancing evening. We'll start cruising towards Korcula.

Description.Title: MLJET - KORCULA
Description.Text:
We’ll leave for an excursion to Mljet.

Walkers’ Program: Walk in the Mljet National Park. After our excursion to the Benedictine monastery, we'll have a short hike towards Pomena (Total length 2½ hours, distance of 4 km (2.5 miles), with a climb of about 100m (328 feet)).

We'll return on board at the end of the morning and start cruising to Korcula.

Non-walker’s Program: Tour of the city and its museum.
Walkers’ Program: Hiking in Hober Park and St Anton. (Length 4 hours, distance of 10 km (6 miles), with a climb of about 300m (984 feet).)

Enjoy a traditional sword dancing evening. We'll start cruising towards Korcula.

Description.Title: KORCULA - SIBENIK
Description.Text:
This morning will be spent cruising through an exceptional landscape, passing the islands of Hvar, Brac, and Split along the way.

Non-walker’s Program: Tour of Sibenik, the oldest Slavic city of the Adriatic and the Krka falls. Also known as "the fortress city", the beautiful town of Sibenik is the oldest native Croatian city on the Adriatic. You’ll have the chance to see the Cathedral of St. James, the most important architectural monument of the Renaissance in the entire country. We’ll then head to the astonishing Krka Falls. This unique environment, home to an especially rich fauna and flora, will take your breath away.

Walkers’ Program: Hike through the Krka National Park on walkways leading past lakes and waterfalls. You’ll be amazed by the unique scenery offered by the impressive collection of 17 waterfalls that range by over 45 meters in height. (Length 4½ hours, distance of 8 km (5 miles), with a climb of about 250m (820 feet).)

Enjoy an evening of onboard entertainment.

Description.Title: KORCULA - SIBENIK
Description.Text:
This morning will be spent cruising through an exceptional landscape, passing the islands of Hvar, Brac, and Split along the way.

Non-walker’s Program: Tour of Sibenik, the oldest Slavic city of the Adriatic and the Krka falls.
Walkers’ Program: Hike through the Krka National Park on walkways leading past lakes and waterfalls. (Length 4½ hours, distance of 8 km (5 miles), with a climb of about 250m (820 feet).)

Enjoy an evening of onboard entertainment.

Description.Title: SIBENIK - TROGIR - SPLIT
Description.Text: Join us for a guided tour of Trogir. Long considered one of the best spots to visit on the Dalmatian coast, Trogir is a treasure trove of delights. Wander through the narrow alleys and retrace the city's 2,500 years of history. Afterwards, we'll cruise towards Split and set out on a guided tour of the Diocletian’s Palace, historic jewel of the city. The charm of this beautiful city lies in its lovely streets and its Old Town built in the heart of Diocletian's Palace, one of the most imposing Roman ruins and some of the most valuable surviving buildings of that era on the Adriatic coast. This evening is free to do as you please.

Description.Title: SIBENIK - TROGIR - SPLIT
Description.Text: Join us for a guided tour of Trogir. Afterwards, we'll cruise towards Split and set out on a guided tour of the Diocletian’s Palace, historic jewel of the city. This evening is free to do as you please.

Description.Title: SPLIT - VIS - HVAR
Description.Text:
We'll reach Hvar, the queen of Dalmatian islands.

Non-walker’s Program: Guided tour of Hvar, the Croatian Saint-Tropez. Discover the magnificent landscapes and the rich cultural heritage of the sunniest island in Croatia.

Walkers’ Program: Hike on Hvar Island where many historic monuments bear witness to the turbulent past of Croatia. Besides admiring the exquisite architecture of the fortress, you will experience an unforgettable panoramic view of the city of Hvar and the Pakleni islands. This excursion is the best way to discover the hidden treasures of Hvar Town. (Length 4½ hours, distance of 12 km (7½ miles), with a climb of about 460m (1,500 feet) - good climbing boots and telescopic trekking poles are highly recommended (not provided).)

After our tours, we'll return on board and start cruising towards Vis. Enjoy time at leisure to discover the city. Tonight's our gala dinner and evening. During the night, our ship will cruise towards Kotor.

Description.Title: SPLIT - VIS - HVAR
Description.Text:
We'll reach Hvar, the queen of Dalmatian islands.

Non-walker’s Program: Guided tour of Hvar, the Croatian Saint-Tropez.
Walkers’ Program: Hike on Hvar Island where many historic monuments bear witness to the turbulent past of Croatia. (Length 4½ hours, distance of 12 km (7½ miles), with a climb of about 460m (1,500 feet) - good climbing boots and telescopic trekking poles are highly recommended (not provided).)

After our tours, we'll return on board and start cruising towards Vis. Enjoy time at leisure to discover the city. Tonight's our gala dinner and evening. During the night, our ship will cruise towards Kotor.

Description.Title: KOTOR - DUBROVNIK
Description.Text:
We'll reach Kotor and its famous bay. The Kotor estuary is quite unique as the sea sweeps in for several miles, forming numerous calm bays.

Non-walker’s Program: Guided tour of Kotor. Wedged between brooding mountains and a moody corner of the bay, Kotor is one of the most beautiful towns on the Adriatic coast. Discover the history, legends and beautiful palaces of the city as you wander through its lovely alleys and past its fortifications built during the Venetian period.

Walkers’ Program: Hike in Kotor. After indulging in local specialties over lunch at a restaurant, we'll hike through the National Park of Lovcen which has some of the most beautiful trails in the country. Mount Lovcen is located in the park and occupies a special place in the hearts of all Montenegrins. (Length 3½ hours, distance of 8 km (5 miles), with a downward climb of about 850m (2,788 feet) - good climbing boots and telescopic trekking poles are necessary (not provided.))

We’ll return on board and start cruising towards Dubrovnik.

Description.Title: KOTOR - DUBROVNIK

We'll reach Kotor and its famous bay. The Kotor estuary is quite unique as the sea sweeps in for several miles, forming numerous calm bays.

Non-walker’s Program: Guided tour of Kotor.

We’ll return on board and start cruising towards Dubrovnik.

You'll be able to hike across many nature parks that are among the most rigorously preserved in Europe, all the while discovering the countryside and dazzling landscapes on the most beautiful islands of the Dalmatian coast.

Description.Title: Additional information
Description.Text:
Level : 3 out of 5
The hikes that are proposed during our cruises are 2 to 5 hours walks, implying changes in altitude that range between 150 and 850 meters (500 to 2800 ft.) depending on the destination. During the hike, you'll get a chance to see and discover some of the natural and cultural areas on your cruise's program.
The lengths of time indicated for the hikes in the program are given as rough estimates and do not include time taken for breaks.
No athletic training is necessary for these hikes, but you should be in good shape and well-rested to fully enjoy this cruise.

Equipment needed
Backpack
You'll need to bring a backpack (max 30 liters / 1,830 cubic inches) to carry the things you'll need for the hike: sweater, raincoat, picnic, bottle of water and sunscreen.
So that you'll be comfortable and enjoy your hike, make sure that you choose a good backpack. We recommend a backpack that is well-made and of the appropriate size, with padded straps, and made of strong fabric that is waterproof. You must carry all materials for your hike yourself, as no porter services are provided.
 

Shoes
Most importantly, you should bring a pair of good-fitting, comfortable shoes. It is best that you use these shoes prior to leaving for your cruise. It is important that you be comfortable in them.
Regardless of the level of difficulty of the hike, your shoes should have a good quality, well sewn-on and non-slip sole for wet or uneven terrain. It is best to choose shoes that provide ankle support and that have shock-absorbing soles to prevent injury to ankles, and back and joint problems.
 

Clothes
You'll be well-prepared for your hike with these essentials:
Undergarments / base layers that are appropriate for the planned hike
Lightweight, quick-drying pants
Warm sweater or fleece jacket
Rain poncho or raincoat
Hat or cap
Thin gloves and a knit cap for the beginning and the end of the season
 

Equipment
Do not forget to bring:
Sunglasses
Sunscreen
Small personal first-aid kit (refer to the following paragraph)
Water bottle
Toilet paper
Folding knife
Telescoping hiking poles if you are used to using them
 

First-aid needs
Your guide will have a first-aid kit for each hike.
Even so, you must bring your own first-aid kit, which differs according to the destination, but will at least include:
Plastic strip bandages
"2nd Skin” or similar blister treatment bandages
Pain reliever
If necessary, mosquito repellent
Eye drops
Anti-diarrhea medication, etc.
You should also include any of your personal medication that you require (prescriptions, for example).

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board our ship at 6 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. We’ll enjoy dinner on board. The rest of the evening is yours to do as you please.

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK - MLJET
Description.Text:
Dubrovnik stands boldly under limestone mountain peaks along the rocky coastline of the gorgeous sea. It is no wonder why Lord Byron described it as the “Pearl of the Adriatic.” Once the center of the Republic of Ragusa, the city’s medieval wall and stone streets are now famous worldwide as the main filming location for King’s Landing in Game of Thrones.

This morning, join us for an excursion:

CLASSIC/FAMILY: Guided tour of Dubrovnik. Dubrovnik is a precious gem that adorns the coast along the Adriatic Sea. Discover the natural beauty and rich history of this majestic city.

In the afternoon, join us for:

FAMILY/CHILDREN: Swimming on Lokrum Island. Lush Lokrum Island is a natural reserve with stone and pebble beaches and swimming nooks. Hop on a local ferry to enjoy an afternoon of swimming in the turquoise waters. 

Or, take advantage of some free time on your own. We suggest a walk along the fortified walls, which completely enclose the old city, are about 1.25 miles long, and reach up to 82 feet high.(1) You’re guaranteed a fantastic view from up there!

After we return on board, we’ll begin to cruise to Mljet. Our ship will cruise through the night.

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK - MLJET
Description.Text:
Excursion offered in the morning:

CLASSIC/FAMILY: Guided tour of Dubrovnik.

Excursion proposed in the afternoon: 

FAMILY/KIDS: Swimming on Lokrum Island. 

Or, free time on your own. We suggest a walk along the city walls.(1)

Description.Title: MLJET - KORCULA
Description.Text:
We’ll arrive in Mljet early in the morning. Join us for an excursion:

CLASSIC/FAMILY/KIDS: Visit Mljet National Park. Once in the park, we’ll set out in rowboats to reach the small island sitting in the middle of a salt lake. We’ll visit the former Benedictine monastery, and you can spend some free time exploring the site on your own.

After our excursion, we’ll return to the ship and begin to cruise to Korcula.

The excursion proposed in the afternoon:

CLASSIC/FAMILY: Guided tour of Korcula. We’ll walk through the town and visit the Cathedral of St. Mark, built by local stonemasons from the 14th to 16th centuries with the help of Italian masters. The facade is decorated with intriguing figures and reliefs. The bell tower is the work of Marko Andrijic, a famous local architect and stonemason.

Tonight’s entertainment will be traditional sword dancing. We’ll begin to cruise to Sibenik during the night.

Description.Title: MLJET - KORCULA
Description.Text:
Excursion proposed:

CLASSIC/FAMILY/KIDS: Visit Mljet National Park on one of the most beautiful islands on the Adriatic.

Excursion proposed in the afternoon:

CLASSIC/FAMILY: Guided tour of charming Korcula.

Tonight’s entertainment will be traditional sword dancing.

Description.Title: KORCULA - SIBENIK
Description.Text:
You’ll arrive in Sibenik during the morning. In the afternoon, we offer two excursions:

CLASSIC: Visit Sibenik and Krka Falls. Sibenik is in the central part of the Croatian Adriatic Coast, in the picturesque and indented bay where the Krka River enters the sea. We’ll tour the historical heart and its labyrinth of streets dating back to the 15th century. Afterwards, we’ll take a coach to Krka Falls. This beautiful site contains a large and clear natural pool with high waterfalls at one end and smaller cascades at the other. After our excursion, we’ll return to the ship.

FAMILY/KIDS: Falconry Center. Discover the just how wonderful and fascinating falcons are! The center, located in a beautiful pine forest, is the perfect place to learn all there is about these amazing creatures. After our excursion, we’ll return to the ship.

Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment. We’ll begin our cruise to Trogir during the night.

Description.Title: KORCULA - SIBENIK
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising. Excursions proposed:

CLASSIC: Visit Sibenik, the oldest Slavic city on the Adriatic Sea, and Krka Falls.

FAMILY/KIDS: Falconry Center. Discover just how wonderful and fascinating falcons are!

Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: SIBENIK - TROGIR - SPLIT
Description.Text:
We’ll arrive in Trogir early in the morning. CLASSIC/FAMILY excursion: Tour of Trogir. Trogir is the prettiest medieval town in the region. Set on an island, the preserved old town is known for its mix of architecture and cobblestone streets. The imposing cathedral is the most stunning example of the variety of architecture.

At the end of our morning, we’ll return on board the ship. Our ship will begin to cruise to Split, arriving at 3 p.m.

In the afternoon, we offer two excursions:

CLASSIC: Guided tour of Split. Split is the second-largest city in Croatia and the heart of central Dalmatia. Diocletian’s Palace, now a UNESCO World Heritage Site, was built by the Romans. Since the 7th century, the palace has been occupied by residents making their homes and businesses directly in the walls.

FAMILY/KIDS: Semi-submarine tour. What better way to look at the bottom of the sea than at the foot of the Sustipan et Katalinic hills than on a semi-submarine! Highly recommended for both kids and adults, this tour is done on a semi-submerged vessel whose cabin is 5 feet below the water level. You’ll immediately feel the magic of the sea from your “ringside” seat. This is a great way to see the local fish life without disturbing their environment.

After our excursion, we’ll return to the ship. We’ll cruise towards Hvar throughout the night.

Description.Title: SIBENIK - TROGIR - SPLIT
Description.Text:
We’ll arrive in Trogir. CLASSIC/FAMILY excursion: Tour of Trogir. Explore the city’s narrow, maze-like streets.

In the afternoon, we offer two excursions:

CLASSIC: Guided tour of Split and Diocletian's Palace—the world's most complete remains of a Roman palace.

FAMILY/KIDS: Semi-submarine tour. Discover the hidden wonders under the sea.

Description.Title: SPLIT - HVAR - VIS
Description.Text:
We’ll arrive in Hvar early in the morning. Join us for an excursion:

CLASSIC/FAMILY: Guided tour of Hvar. Hvar is a well-known summer resort island. Its long, lean mountain peaks extend from the east to the west. Posh Hvar Town is a swanky place to party and “The Place to Be.” All streets lead to the largest square in Dalmatia and the Cathedral of St. Stephen, known for its valuable treasures and paintings.

In the afternoon as an option (not included in packages): Bike across Vis Island. Vis, one of the best-preserved islands in Croatia, served as the backdrop for the sequel to Mama Mia. The island was once forbidden to tourists but now is open for all to enjoy its stony crags and amazing scenery. Low car traffic makes it the perfect place to bike. Discover Vis on two wheels as you glide past the pretty homes in quaint Mediterranean hamlets and through the vast vineyards.

In the afternoon, we'll begin to cruise towards Kotor. Our ship will cruise through the night. Tonight we’ll enjoy our gala dinner on board.

Description.Title: SPLIT - HVAR - VIS
Description.Text:
Join us for an excursion:

CLASSIC/FAMILY: Guided tour of Hvar, known as the San-Tropez of Croatia.

In the afternoon as an option (not included in packages): Discover the hidden treasures of Vis on a bike.

Tonight is our festive gala evening.

Description.Title: KOTOR - DUBROVNIK
Description.Text:
The morning will be spent cruising through the Bay of Kotor. Here, the sea spreads out into rippling gulfs and sparkling straits, each more beautiful than the other. The land is treated to an abundance of rainfall and a mild climate, creating the lush vegetation that adorns the hills. Our ship will arrive in Kotor by late morning.

CLASSIC/FAMILY excursion: Visit Kotor. The medieval city of Kotor, Montenegro, has survived the ravages of weather and wars. It’s an exciting labyrinth where the past meets the present, set against gorgeous seaside scenery.

Description.Title: KOTOR - DUBROVNIK
Description.Text: We’ll spend the morning cruising. CLASSIC/FAMILY excursion: Visit the city of Kotor, an exciting labyrinth where the past meets the present.

Description.Title: CORFU (Greece)
Description.Text: We'll spend the morning cruising to the splendid island of Corfu. According to Homer's poems, Ulysses made a final stop here before returning to Ithaca. This afternoon, we'll enjoy a tour of the old city. Today a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the origins of the old city date back to the 8th century BC, but what we see today is approximately 500 years old, built mostly by the Venetians. And we'll visit the Achilleion, the island's emblematic palace built by the beloved Empress Sissi. Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing.

Description.Title: CORFU (Greece)
Description.Text: We'll spend the morning cruising to the splendid island of Corfu. According to Homer's poems, Ulysses made a final stop here before returning to Ithaca. And we'll visit the Achilleion, the island's emblematic palace built by the beloved Empress Sissi. Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing.

Description.Title: CORFU - SARANDA (Albania)
Description.Text:
We'll cruise to Saranda in the early morning. When we arrive, join us for a visit to the Butrint ruins (an approx. 4-hour tour, including over 90 minutes of driving). These ancient ruins are famed for their size, beauty, and tranquility. They're in a fantastic natural setting and span 2,500 years. The top of the hill is where the acropolis once was; the views give you a good idea of the city's layout, and you can see the Vivari Channel connecting Lake Butrint to the Straits of Corfu in the distance.
This afternoon, we'll set out on a tour of Gjirokastër (an approx. 5-hour tour, including 3 hours of driving). Historic Gjirokastër is one of Albania's three UNESCO sites. Described as "a rare example of a well-preserved Ottoman town,¿ the city is dominated by Gjirokastër Fortress. Gjirokastër contains several remarkable examples of houses with turrets, which date from the 17th century, but also more elaborate examples dating from the early 19th century. The Gjirokastër Bazaar is known for handmade wood pieces, handwoven rugs, and crafts such as delicate lace items. We'll enjoy a tasting of local products at the end of our tour. Join us for an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: VLORE
Description.Text: Join us for a full-day tour of Apollonia and Berat (lunch included - approx. 10.5 hours long, including 4.5 hours of driving). Our first stop will be Berat. In 2008, the village was designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site as it is a rare example of a well-preserved Ottoman town. We'll then continue on to the largest archaeological site in Albania: Apollonia. Set on rolling hills among olive groves, with impressive views all around, Apollonia was founded by Greeks from Corinth and Corfu in 588 BC. While the ruins are minimal, the onsite Apollonia Museum complex is excellent to experience. We'll return on board. Tonight's festivities will have an Albanian flair!

Description.Title: VLORE

Description.Title: DURRËS
Description.Text:
This morning, we’ll visit Tirana and its Natural History Museum (free excursion, approximately 5 hours long, including 2 hours of driving). Tirana, the capital and largest city, is the heart of Albania's cultural, economic, and governmental activity. We'll visit the National History Museum, which takes you chronologically from ancient Illyria to the post-communist era. We’ll also see Skanderbeg Square, where you can get a good look at the city’s oldest building, the historic Et'hem Bey Mosque (the mosque is currently closed for renovations; the initial visit to this site will be replaced by a tour of the Blloku area). Once the area where the communist elite resided, it is now an upscale location for dining, shopping, and entertainment. Blloku is also well-known for its colorful, sometimes garish facades that contrast with the gray Soviet-era buildings. The simple, three-story former residence of Enver Halil Hoxha, head of Albania for over 40 years, can still be seen on Ismail Qemali Street.
We'll spend the afternoon cruising. Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing.

Description.Title: BAR (Montenegro)
Description.Text:
We'll spend the morning on a visit to Stari Bar. Enjoy a guided tour of this old urban settlement in the mountains above the city of Bar. The tranquil feel of this place will make you fall in love with the whole country. Together with the stronghold towers, city gates, gun powder room, Prince's Palace, and Bishop's Palace, one can imagine the impressive town that it used to be.
We'll spend the afternoon cruising alongside Montenegrin coastline and through the Bay of Kotor.
Tonight is our festive gala evening.

Description.Title: LARNACA (Cyprus)
Description.Text: This morning, join us for an excursion to Nicosia. The Cypriot capital has two faces and symbolizes two contrasting cultures united by a shared history. Brimming with gems to discover, Nicosia stands as the last officially divided European city. This afternoon, enjoy some free time to discover Larnaca on your own. We'll start sailing towards Israel at the end of the day.

Description.Title: HAIFA (Israel)
Description.Text: Full-day excursion through Galilee including the Sea of Galilee (lunch included; approx. 9 hours total, including 4 hours round trip). The Sea of Galilee, a freshwater lake also known as Lake Tiberias or Kinneret in Hebrew, is the main water source in Israel and crystallizes for Christians the place where many of the events described in the Bible occurred. Our excursion will first take you to Cana (or Kafr Cana), where Jesus performed the miracle of transforming water into wine. We'll continue on to the Mount of Beatitudes, from where there are wonderful views of Lake Tiberias. This is the hill where Jesus is believed to have delivered his “Sermon on the Mount”. We'll next head for Tabgha, believed to be the most beautiful and peaceful of holy Christian sites and which was the scene of many Gospel stories, before moving on to Capernaum, the base camp for Jesus during his Galilean ministry.

Description.Title: HAIFA (Israel)
Description.Text: Full-day excursion to Jerusalem and Bethlehem (lunch included; approx. 12 hours total, including 4 hours round trip). In Bethlehem, we’ll visit the Church of the Nativity, which contains the grotto where many Christians believe Jesus was born. We’ll continue on to Jerusalem, considered holy ground by three religions—Christianity, Judaism, and Islam. The old city contains over 200 historic sites, including the Wailing Wall and the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, which encompasses the hill where Jesus was crucified and his tomb. We will also visit the colorful market where the three main religions live side by side.

Description.Title: HAIFA (Israel)
Description.Text: Full-day excursion including Masada and the Dead Sea (lunch included; approx. 12 hours total, incl. 5 hours round trip). Masada is one of Israel’s most popular tourist destinations. The breathtaking, strategic location is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a symbol of heroism and importance within Jewish culture. Masada was built in 30 BC by King Herod. When Israel began its great revolt against Rome in 68 AD, the site became a stronghold for Jewish rebels. The Romans besieged Masada in the year 72. Rather than be taken alive by their adversaries, the population of Masada chose to die by suicide. After our stirring visit to this important historical site, we will continue to the Dead Sea for lunch and an afternoon at the side of the pool or in the sea’s beneficial waters and muds.

Description.Title: HAIFA (Israel) - LIMASSOL (Cyprus)
Description.Text:
This morning, guided tour of Nazareth. We'll set off for our discovery tour of Nazareth, travelling through the lovely hills of Upper Galilee and the historic Jezreel Valley until we reach the spot where the Angel Gabriel told the Virgin Mary that she would give birth to the Messiah. We'll visit the Church of the Annunciation, the largest Catholic church in the Middle East and one of the holiest shrines in the Christian world. Then, we'll continue to the Greek Orthodox Church of St Gabriel, where the water from an underground spring flows through the apse and into the adjacent Mary's Well. Finally, we will visit St Joseph's Church, built in 1914 on the very spot believed to be the workshop of Joseph the carpenter.

We'll spend all afternoon sailing towards Limassol.

Description.Title: LIMASSOL - LARNACA (Cyprus)
Description.Text:
This morning, excursion to Paphos Archaeological Park. Listed by UNESCO as a World Heritage Site since 1980, this exceptional site features the Tombs of the Kings, a mysterious underground necropolis located amidst an almost deserted landscape. We'll then visit the houses of Dionysos, Theseus and Aion whose splendid mosaics were discovered by chance in 1962. A few kilometers further on, we will stop in the village of Yeroskipou to visit a small workshop where Loukoum (Cyprus Delight) is made, followed by a tasting session.

The afternoon will be spent sailing towards Larnaca.

Tonight’s our gala dinner and evening.

Description.Title: ATHENS
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. We’ll have dinner and enjoy traditional Greek entertainment on board.

Description.Title: ATHENS
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for a visit to Athens and the Acropolis. We’ll explore the Acropolis, an ancient religious center in Athens, which includes the Temple of Athena Nike and the iconic Parthenon. After our visit, enjoy a coach tour of the capital of Greece.

The afternoon can be spent on an excursion to the Apollo Coast and Cape Sounion. The route along the coast travels around the rim of the Saronic Gulf all the way to Cape Sounion. The promontory on the southernmost tip of the Attic peninsula looks west towards Patroklos, across the Aegean Sea. The cape is most noted for the ruins of the Temple of Poseidon, dating back to the Golden Age of Athens.

After our tour, we’ll begin to cruise towards Delos.

Description.Title: ATHENS
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for a visit to Athens and the Acropolis. After our visit, enjoy a coach tour of the capital of Greece.

The afternoon can be spent on an excursion to the Apollo Coast and Cape Sounion. 

After our tour, we’ll begin to cruise towards Delos.

Description.Title: DELOS - MYKONOS
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for an excursion to the island of Delos (travel to and from the island will be done in rowboats). Delos has been considered a sacred island since ancient times. Greek mythology recounts the island as the birthplace of both Apollo and Artemis, and it has played an important role over many millennia as a religious and economic center. We'll visit the sanctuary dedicated to Apollo, the Terrace of the Lions, and several ruins of homes with superb mosaic art.

In the afternoon, we'll set out on an excursion to the island of Mykonos. It sits tall among the Cyclades and is dotted with charming Mediterranean villages. It is also known for its idyllic, golden beaches leading to the pristine, turquoise waters. We’ll visit the Monastery of Panagia Tourliani, the official protector of the island. Built in the 1500s, tourists visit it not only for the religious experience but for its outstanding architecture. The whitewashed exterior and colored dome houses an impressive wooden altar screen, decorated with icons of saints and flowers. We'll return to Mykonos Town to take in the pure charm of the city, one of the biggest attractions after the beach.

After our tour, we’ll begin to cruise towards Santorini.

Description.Title: DELOS - MYKONOS
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for an excursion to the island of Delos. Delos has been considered a sacred island since ancient times.

In the afternoon, we'll set out on an excursion to the island of Mykonos. It sits tall among the Cyclades and is dotted with charming Mediterranean villages.

After our tour, we’ll begin to cruise towards Santorini.

Description.Title: SANTORINI
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for an excursion to the island of Santorini (travel to and from the island will be done in rowboats). Spend your time taking in the picturesque sites on the island, admiring the scenery from impressive vistas, or enjoying local delicacies at the Mediterranean cafés and restaurants. Our coach will bring us up to the monastery of Profitis Ilias, which offers full panoramic views of the island from the 18th-century sanctuary. We'll then head one of the most striking villages on the island, Megalochori, to enjoy the ambiance of its historic mansions and old traditional houses. We'll stop off at a wine cellar for a tasting* of the local spirits. The gorgeous village of Fira, perched on the edge of a high caldera that faces west across the sea, will be our last stop.

We’ll begin to cruise to Rhodes.

Description.Title: SANTORINI
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for an excursion to the island of Santorini. Spend your time taking in the picturesque sites on the island. We'll stop off at a wine cellar for a tasting* of the local spirits.

We’ll begin to cruise to Rhodes.

Description.Title: RHODES
Description.Text:
In the morning, join us for a visit to ancient and medieval Rhodes. Our first stop will be Monte Smith and its splendid panoramic view of the island and the surrounding seascapes. We’ll pass through the impressive d’Amboise Gate to the highest point within the fortifications, the Palace of the Grand Master, an imposing fortress with relics from the medieval period as well as ancient sculptures and beautiful 1st-century mosaics. Our tour will continue on the Street of the Knights. Completely restored and beautifully preserved, it is lined by the buildings where holy warriors spent their time in prayer or military practice. Each building is an ‘inn’ for the language spoken according to the knights’ birthplace: England, France, Germany, Italy, Aragon, Auvergne, or Provence. A distinct, noble ambiance still seems to float in the air. What we see now, though, owes much to Italian restorations during the 1930s.

Our ship will cruise to Cyprus overnight.

Description.Title: RHODES
Description.Text:
In the morning, join us for a visit to ancient and medieval Rhodes. Our first stop will be Monte Smith and its splendid panoramic view of the island and the surrounding seascapes.

Our ship will cruise to Cyprus overnight.

Description.Title: LIMASSOL
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising.

After lunch, join us for a tour of the archaeological ruins in Paphos, classified as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. We'll visit the impressive, underground tombs dating back to the 4th century BC that sport a distinct Egyptian influence. The remains of villas, palaces, theaters, fortresses, and tombs mean that the site is of exceptional architectural and historical value. We’ll continue to the coastal town of Yeroskipou to visit a Loukoum (Turkish Delight) factory, including a tasting.

After our tour, we’ll return on board and begin to cruise to Larnaca.

Description.Title: NICE
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. Tonight, we’ll enjoy dinner and an evening of activities on board. Our ship will cruise to Corsica overnight.

Description.Title: AJACCIO - The Calanques de Piana
Description.Text: We’ll spend the morning cruising and the afternoon on an excursion to the Calanques de Piana. These sheer cliffs and rock sculptures seem to jet up from the water and radiate a red hue along the coastline. During our tour, we’ll also stop at one of the panoramic viewpoints to admire the amazing landscape.

Description.Title: AJACCIO - The Calanques de Piana
Description.Text: We’ll spend the morning cruising and the afternoon on an excursion to the Calanques de Piana. These sheer cliffs and rock sculptures seem to jet up from the water and radiate a red hue along the coastline. During our tour, we’ll also stop at one of the panoramic viewpoints to admire the amazing landscape.

Description.Title: AJACCIO
Description.Text:
Join us for an optional excursion this morning through the Corsican maquis. You’ll discover untamed Corsica and one of the most beautiful valleys in the region as you plunge into the heart of the Corsican maquis. We’ll also enjoy a tasting of local cheese and cold cuts.

This afternoon, we’ll set out on an excursion to Ajaccio and the Îles Sanguinaires. We’ll first follow Napoleon’s trail through the old city before visiting the captivating beauty found on the outlying islands.

Our ship will cruise to Bonifacio. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: AJACCIO
Description.Text:
Join us for an optional excursion this morning through the Corsican maquis. You’ll discover untamed Corsica and one of the most beautiful valleys in the region as you plunge into the heart of the Corsican maquis. We’ll also enjoy a tasting of local cheese and cold cuts.

This afternoon, we’ll set out on an excursion to Ajaccio and the Îles Sanguinaires. We’ll first follow Napoleon’s trail through the old city before visiting the captivating beauty found on the outlying islands.

Our ship will cruise to Bonifacio. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: BONIFACIO
Description.Text:
This morning, we’ll set out on a guided tour of Bonifacio. The city is rich with a history told among its small streets and paths, a thousand-year-old fortress, and the sturdy stone homes perched high above the sea waves. The descent (and subsequent ascent) of the King of Aragon’s Stairway will provide some of the best views on the trip (187 steps) .

Enjoy a free afternoon on your own or join us for an excursion to the nature reserve on the Archipelago of Lavezzi. The islands are scattered with sculpted granite boulders and have a network of clearly marked footpaths to take in all the views. We’ll return on board to cruise towards Porto Vecchio as we drift by nature reserves and splendid seascapes dotted with faraway islands. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: PORTO VECCHIO
Description.Text:
In the morning, we’ll set out on a guided tour of Porto Vecchio. The old town includes the ruins of a 16th-century citadel and gorgeous views of the marina.

The afternoon will be spent cruising to Bastia. Feel free to take part in some of the onboard activities offered.

Description.Title: PORTO VECCHIO
Description.Text:

The afternoon will be spent cruising to Bastia. Feel free to take part in some of the onboard activities offered.

Description.Title: BASTIA
Description.Text: Join us for an excursion to Cap Corse (including lunch).  Located to the north of Bastia and Saint-Florent, Cap Corse is a 25-mile long promontory with several attractive fishing villages, a gorgeous coastline, and a couple of good beaches. We’ll enjoy a tasting of local wine, cold-cuts, and cheese before returning on board to cruise towards L'Ile Rousse.

Description.Title: BASTIA
Description.Text: Join us for an excursion to Cap Corse (including lunch).  Located to the north of Bastia and Saint-Florent, Cap Corse is a 25-mile long promontory with several attractive fishing villages, a gorgeous coastline, and a couple of good beaches. Description.Title: L'ILE ROUSSE
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for a tour of Calvi and its citadel. You’ll discover its large marina and immense bay surrounded by its unique landscape and often snow-capped mountains. We’ll head toward Notre Dame de la Serra to get a magnificent view of the gulf. Our tour will continue at the citadel. The symbol of the town of Calvi, it was built during the Genoese occupation.

OR

Discover the old villages in the Balagne Region during an optional excursion.  These are the fertile hills of the island, commonly referred to as the Corsican gardens. We’ll travel through the region and visit a few of the more than thirty villages perched on cliffs or hidden in narrow valleys.

Take advantage of some downtime on our afternoon cruise towards Nice. Tonight is our festive gala evening.

Description.Title: Additional information
Description.Text:
INTERNET

SATELLITE CONNECTIONS

Our ship provides Internet connection via satellite while we cruise, which is different and slower than what we are used to through our regular home or office services. We cannot guarantee connection at all times. Please keep this in mind while you are enjoying your vacation with us.

TELEPHONE SERVICE

DURING CRUISE

When we are at sea, you can connect your device(s) to the onboard GSM/3G network. Your service provider will automatically send you the terms and conditions of use for this service. You will be able to make calls, send messages, or use the Internet through this network’s roaming services. The GSM network will be turned off once the ship enters a port.

WHILE IN PORT

When the ship is in a port, you will be able to receive and make calls via your international calling/service plan according to the country you are visiting.

WATCH OUT FOR SERVICE FEES

We strongly recommend that you contact your service provider before your departure; international calls and data usage can be very costly and are almost never included in basic operator packages.

PLEASE CHECK THE SETTINGS FOR YOUR DEVICE

Once you are on board, but before you connect to the Internet, please check the settings for your device(s).  We request that you limit the downloading of videos and large-volume files. Automatic updates to your PC, tablet, and smartphones will affect the speed and cost of your connection. You probably have automatic updates for apps on your devices that you are not aware of. We recommend that you deactivate these updates while you are staying with us.
